intro: Streptosiphon hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy streptosiphon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in groups of three. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine pubescence. Streptosiphon hirsutus is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
